byline.contributor: Falih Hassan reported from Baghdad, and Tim Arango from Istanbul. Omar Al-Jawoshy contributed reporting from Baghdad.
byline.original: By FALIH HASSAN and TIM ARANGO

abstract: Iraqi Prime Min Haider al-Abadi announces that government military forces will try to retake Falluja, city that has been under Islamic State’s control for more than two years.
lead_paragraph: Any ground battle to liberate the city, a stronghold of Sunni extremism that fell to the Islamic State more than two years ago, is likely to be long and bloody.

headline.main: Iraqi Forces Try to Retake Falluja From ISIS
headline.print_headline: Iraqi Leader Declares Assault to Free City From ISIS

snippet: Any ground battle to liberate the city, a stronghold of Sunni extremism that fell to the Islamic State more than two years ago, is likely to be long and bloody.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
